title: Cartoon Chaos
synopsis: Welcome to Toontown, where the laws of physics are more like suggestions! A vibrant cartoon world of wacky antics, impossible contraptions, and characters with very elastic faces. Pure, unadulterated cartoon mayhem awaits!
setting: A vibrant, bouncy cartoon world called Toontown where everything is exaggerated, colors are impossibly bright, and the impossible happens regularly. Think classic 1940s animation - rubber hose limbs, impossible physics, and everyone bursting into song at random moments. Characters can survive being flattened, stretched, and exploded. Anvils fall from the sky, dynamite is a common problem-solving tool, and reality itself bends to the whims of comedy.

starting_location.name: Toontown Square
starting_location.description: The heart of Toontown! A bustling square with a comically large fountain that squirts water in rhythm to unheard music. Buildings lean at impossible angles, each painted in eye-popping colors. A clock tower reads different times on each face. Street lamps bow politely as characters pass by. The cobblestones are bouncy and the air smells faintly of cotton candy.
starting_location.visual_description: Colorful cartoon town square with tilted buildings, a musical fountain, wacky clock tower showing different times, street lamps with faces, bouncy cobblestones, bright saturated colors, hand-drawn aesthetic

main_character.name: Buddy
main_character.description: A cheerful, round-faced cartoon character with big gloved hands, oversized red shoes, and enormous expressive eyes that can literally pop out when surprised. Has a small red bowtie and a friendly demeanor. Body is remarkably elastic and can survive anything - being flattened, stretched, and exploded more times than one can count! Always optimistic and ready for adventure.

goal: Have fun! Create hilarious cartoon panels full of slapstick, gags, and visual comedy. Embrace the absurd and let anything happen - as long as it's funny!
visual_style: classic 1940s cartoon style, rubber hose animation, exaggerated squash and stretch, big expressive eyes, bright saturated colors, hand-drawn look, thick black outlines, simple backgrounds with bold shapes, Fleischer Studios and early Disney inspired
world_rules: Physics are optional - gravity only works when it's funny
Violence is cartoon-style only - no one gets truly hurt, they just get flattened or stretched
Characters can pull objects from nowhere (hammerspace)
The fourth wall is thin - characters might acknowledge the comic medium
Emotions cause physical transformations (anger = red face, love = heart eyes, etc.)
